intro: Blechnum chiriquanum, commonly known as the Chiriquí fern, is a species of polypod fern native to Central America. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its fronds that are typically bi- or tri-pinnate. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests and mountainous regions. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help anchor it to rocky substrates. The leaves are leathery and have a distinctive, elongated shape, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
